author: Special Correspondent
text:
The annual conference and exhibition of the Institute of Indian Foundrymen (IIF) here this month will have a ‘smart foundry’ developed by IIT Mumbai. The foundry’s functioning will be demonstrated at the venue.

Southern region chairman of the Institute Nithyanandan Devaraj and organising committee chairman for the event C. R. Swaminathan told presspersons here on Wednesday that about 2,000 technicians, foundry owners and students were expected to attend the event, which would have two CEO meets on nurturing manufacturing and building sustainability.

Programme

A parallel programme – Cast Expo – would be held to showcase the capabilities of Indian foundries, especially MSMEs.

A buyer-seller meet would be organised and 12 MNC customers had confirmed their participation. Four young generation entrepreneurs would speak at the sessions for the student forum.

“Though the market is not good, foundries need to invest now in technology,” said Mr. Swaminathan. According to Mr. Devaraj, foundries need to invest in automation in areas such as process monitoring and use of sensors.

All stakeholders in the foundry sector need to focus on foundry value chain to capitalise on the opportunities from the Make in India initiative, the organisers said.

The foundry exhibition, cast source meet, cast India expo and technical sessions will be held at the CODISSIA Trade Fair Complex from January 29 to 31.
title: ‘Smart Foundry’ demonstration at exhibition
